sentences.en: a rule that is no longer in force.
sentences.cn: 不再有效的规则

sentences.en: Demonstrators were out in force.
sentences.cn: 大批示威者上街

sentences.en: Due to the high cost of borrowing, many companies have been forced to close.
sentences.cn: 由于借贷成本高，许多公司被迫关门。

sentences.en: economic cutbacks were forced on the government.
sentences.cn: 政府被迫削减开支。

sentences.en: exercising authority by force of arms.
sentences.cn: 凭武力掌权。

sentences.en: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.cn: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.en: He changed our world through the force of his ideas.
sentences.cn: 他通过自己观念的力量改变了我们的世界。

sentences.en: He had wrenched his ankle badly from the force of the fall.
sentences.cn: 他因摔倒而严重扭伤了脚踝。

sentences.en: It would force industries to be more careful with natural resources.
sentences.cn: 这将迫使企业更加节约资源。

sentences.en: More vigorous action is needed to force the federal army to disengage.
sentences.cn: 需要更强有力的行动来迫使联邦军队撤军。

sentences.en: Never force your legs to overstretch, or you can cause injuries.
sentences.cn: 千万不要迫使双腿过度拉伸，否则会受伤的。

sentences.en: Northerly winds will increase to force six by midday.
sentences.cn: 到中午时分北风会加强到6级。

sentences.en: Peace cannot be imposed by force .
sentences.cn: 和平不能通过武力来实现。

sentences.en: Perhaps your force of argument might have made some difference.
sentences.cn: 或许是你的雄辩使情况发生了变化。

sentences.en: Police are out in force to prevent a recurrence of the violence.
sentences.cn: 警方出动大量警力防止暴力事件再次发生。

sentences.en: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.cn: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

sentences.en: The Afghan air force was using helicopters to supply the besieged town.
sentences.cn: 阿富汗空军正用直升机向被围城镇提供补给。

sentences.en: The force of the explosion blew out all the windows.
sentences.cn: 爆炸的冲力把所有的窗子都震碎了。

sentences.en: The force of the water washed him back into the cave.
sentences.cn: 大水把他冲回到洞里。

sentences.en: The police force is being manipulated for political ends.
sentences.cn: 有人为了政治目的在操纵警方。

sentences.en: The UN will allow the use of force against aircraft violating the zone.
sentences.cn: 联合国将允许对侵犯这一地区的飞机采取军事行动。

sentences.en: They used force to banish the natives from the more fertile land.
sentences.cn: 他们使用武力把土著居民驱逐出了比较肥沃的土地。

sentences.en: They wanted the army reduced to a police force.
sentences.cn: 他们想把这支队伍降级为一支警察部队。

sentences.en: Volunteers constitute more than 95% of The Center's work force.
sentences.cn: 该中心95%以上的工作人员是志愿者.

sentences.en: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.cn: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.en: Women officers make up 13 per cent of the police force.
sentences.cn: 女警占警力的13%。

words.tran_cn: 强有力的；有说服力的；坚强的
强有力地；激烈地；有说服力地

phrases.tran_cn: 强迫地；靠武力；凭藉暴力
迫使仓促行动：迫使某人在条件未成熟或不情愿的情况下行动或发言
（比赛中为迅速拖垮对手）加速
n. 劳动力，劳动大军；劳动人口；（工厂等在职的）工人总数；职工总数

trans.tran_cn: 暴力，力量，影响力，(物理学)力，风力级数，军事力量，警察机关
trans.tran_en: military action used as a way of achieving your aims

trans.tran_cn: 强迫，强行，把…强加给，用力推动
trans.tran_en: to make someone do something they do not want to do

trans.tran_cn: 强迫， 迫使； 用力推动； 强行打开
trans.tran_en: to make someone do something they do not want to do
